boardgame.name: Game of Trains
Game of trains 迷途小火車
Gra o Tor
Sínen vagyunk
boardgame.description: In Game of Trains, each player is in charge for his line of trains. At the beginning of the game, the train cars in the player's train line _T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp;mdash; each with their own number _T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp;mdash; are sorted in descending order. The aim of the game is to be the first one to rearrange your train line so that the cards are in ascending order. Each card has a train car with a number and also a special power depicted on it._T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;On a turn, the player can do one of two things: draw a card from the draw pile and replace one of the cards in his train line with the newly drawn card, or take a face-up card from the middle of the table and use it as a special power. Cards that are replaced from a player's train line are put in the middle to be used as special powers, and the cards that are used as special powers are discarded. Special powers include such actions as swapping two cards, moving a card, destroying everyone's cards, and so on. The players keep taking turns until one has their train line in ascending order and wins._T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;
boardgame.boardgamehonor: 2016 Game Expo Best General Card Game Winner
boardgame.boardgamepodcastepisode: Episode #253 - Game of Trains is Major Fun
Garrett_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_#039;s Games 500 - Best of 2015 + Contest Resolution!
Origins, Cruises, CMON Interview, and Philip played Spyfall - Boards _T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp;amp; Swords #83
The Game Pit Podcast: Episode 63 - UK Games Expo 2016

result.value: Some necessary text - easily memorized or small crib sheet
Moderate in-game text - needs crib sheet or paste ups
Extensive use of text - massive conversion needed to be playable

My favourite of the games I played at Spiel _T_E_M_P_T_A_G_#039;15, there_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_#039;s not a lot to Game of Trains, but it_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_#039;s great fun. You start with a row of railway cars in descending order. First to have a row in ascending order wins. Sounds simple, eh? If only... The price shown is for UK/EU purchasers (and includes VAT). For purchasers outside the EU, the price is £5.42 (net of UK tax) - note that the purchaser is responsible for paying any duty or tax due on import to their country. I charge shipping at cost, as follows. UK addresses: £2.98 (myHermes, takes 3 working days, tracked) Other EU countries: £4.74 (Air mail, takes 1 week or so, not tracked) Europe outside the EU: £3.95 (Air mail, takes 1 week or so, not tracked) Australasia: £5.45 (Air mail, takes 1 week or so, not tracked) USA, Canada _T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp; elsewhere: £5.00 (Air mail, takes 1 week or so, not tracked)
